definition: A substance or matter from which things can be made or which has specific properties for construction, manufacturing, or covering.

positive_examples: The fabric felt soft against her skin as she examined the texture.
The photographer loaded a fresh roll of film into his vintage camera.
The blacksmith heated the metal until it glowed red-hot in the forge.
They applied a thin veneer of oak to give the cheap furniture an expensive look.
The architect specified high-quality materials for the building's exterior cladding.
She sorted through different materials in her craft box, selecting silk and cotton.
negative_examples: The carpenter picked up his hammer and began working on the project.
The ancient pottery bowl displayed intricate geometric patterns.
She opened the jewelry box to reveal her grandmother's necklace.
The mechanic replaced the broken engine part with a new component.
He collected vintage coins from around the world as a hobby.
The artist displayed her finished painting in the gallery window.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Tool, Jewelry, Pottery, Weapon, Coin
